list_definition.definition: a place full of long, winding passages, maze

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The basement is a labyrinth of corridors.

list_ex_of_english: This labyrinth, being sheltered by the building, will be at a temperature close to the mean ground temperature, like a cellar or cave.
In this referential labyrinth, the two media, although simultaneous, are never identical.
These labyrinths are apparently connected to each other.
The finite difference computer program gives a satisfactory answer to the problem of leakage in the labyrinth seal.
Our art intentionally adds conflicting information to this silicon labyrinth: musically, culturally and contextually.
A political labyrinth emerged from this contradictory attitude.
The very elaborated exhibition spaces seemed inflexible and overworked, again more of a labyrinth than an enjoyable spatial progression.
Here, the city appears as a labyrinth that threatens the subject with deracination in the midst of a fast-paced economy.
